Variation Sentence: Unprotected openings shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an unprotected opening serving another fire compartment, or in one dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite is within 3 m horizontally of the unprotected openings serving another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and the exterior walls of the fire compartments, dwelling units, ancillary spaces and common spaces in a house with a secondary suite referred to in Sentence 9.9.4.6. intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°.
Full Code Sentence: Unprotected openings in exterior walls of the building shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5.and 9.10.13.7., where an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp provides the only means of egress from a suite and is exposed to fire from unprotected openings in the exterior walls of another fire compartment, or another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and unprotected openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.

Variation Sentence: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
Full Code Sentence: Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy or in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.

Variation Sentence: The airflow measurements required by Sentences 9.32.3.4. and 9.32.3.4. shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.
Full Code Sentence: The airflow measurements required by Sentence 9.32.3.5. shall be done using a method accurate to within ±15% of the flow rate being measured.

Variation Sentence: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentences 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.2.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)
Full Code Sentence: Doorways serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite need not comply with Sentence 9.9.6.3.(2). (See also Article 9.5.5.1.)

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Articles 6.9.4.2. and Article 6.3.1.5., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the requirements of CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
Full Code Sentence: The installation of service water heaters, including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I

Variation Sentence: Windows, doors, skylights and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1., part 5. and part 5., or Article 5.9.2.2., where they are covered in the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 5.9.2.2.(1).
Full Code Sentence: Windows, doors, skylights and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1., Section 5.4. and Section 5.6., or Article 5.9.2.2., where they are covered in the scope of the standards listed in Sentence 5.9.2.2.(1). (See Note A-5.9.2.3.(1).)

Variation Sentence: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the requirements in CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights and CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights
Full Code Sentence: This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard).

Variation Sentence: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.
Full Code Sentence: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Articles 6.9.4.2. and Article 6.3.1.5., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the requirements of CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA B365-17 Installation Code for Solid-Fuel-Burning Appliances and Equipment or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Articles 9.33.5.3.and 9.33.5.4., the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to CSA B51-14 Boiler, Pressure Vessel, and Pressure Piping Code CSA B52-13 Mechanical Refrigeration Code CSA B139-09 Installation Code for Oil-Burning Equipment CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I or CSA C448 Series-13 Design and Installation of Earth Energy Systems (See also Sentence 9.33.5.3.(1).) (See Note A-9.33.5.3.)

Variation Sentence: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.
Full Code Sentence: Landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.

Variation Sentence: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is mechanically cooled, its non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust air from inside the room or space, or to introduce outdoor air into that room or space, at a rate conforming with Table 9.32.2.3., or comply with part 9.
Full Code Sentence: Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of liquefied petroleum gases shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code and CSA B149.2-10 Propane Storage and Handling Code
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in this Part, the storage and handling of natural gas shall conform to CSA B149.1-10 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code

Variation Sentence: This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings .
Full Code Sentence: This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings.

Variation Sentence: Potable water shall be used to test a potablewater system.
Full Code Sentence: Potable water shall be used to test a potable water system.

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of applying the requirements of Subsections 3. and 3. to self-service storage buildings, building area shall mean the building area of each building, or the total of the building areas of all buildings as a group.
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of applying the requirements of Subsections 3.2.1.and 3.2.2. to self-service storage buildings, building area shall mean the building area of each building, or the total of the building areas of all buildings as a group. (See Note A-3.9.2.1.(1).) (See Note A-3.9.2.2.)

Variation Sentence: Where an exit is located in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the exit shall be protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls separating the exit from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the exit from the remainder of the building.
Full Code Sentence: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3. for closures.)

Variation Sentence: The installation of electrical wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to the requirements of provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Sentence 3.6.1.2.(1).
Full Code Sentence: An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7.(2)to 3.6.2.7. if it is required by provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in Clause 3.6.2.7.(1)(a).

Variation Sentence: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.2.(2), where Table 9.10.15.4. is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual vertical portions of the wall measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling. (See Note A-9.10.15.4.(2).)
Full Code Sentence: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

Variation Sentence: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators
Full Code Sentence: Mechanical ventilation devices shall conform to CSA C22.2 No. 113-10 Fans and Ventilators (See Note A-9.32.3.11.)

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.81. provided it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.81.
Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group F, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.78. provided it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.78.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.81. provided it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.81.
Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group A, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.30. provided it is not more than 2 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.30.

Variation Sentence: Each construction camp building shall be provided with portable fire extinguishers in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NFC.
Full Code Sentence: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, the NFC.

Variation Sentence: The continuity of a fire separation or smoke-tight barrier shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation or smoke-tight barrier, a floor, a ceiling, a roof, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Notes A-9.10.9.2. and A-3.1.8.3.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: The continuity of a fire separation shall be maintained where it abuts another fire separation, a floor, a ceiling, a roof, or an exterior wall assembly. (See Note A-3.1.8.3.(4).) (See Note A-3.1.8.3.(4).)

Variation Sentence: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.81. to 3.2.2.90., a building classified as Group F, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.80.(2).
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.75.to 3.2.2.79., a building classified as Group F, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.74.(2).

Variation Sentence: Door-operating devices shall comply with Sentence 3.8.3.8.(1), and be operable at a height between 900 mm and 1 100 mm above the floor.
Full Code Sentence: Door-operating devices shall comply with Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b), and be operable at a height between 900 mm and 1 100 mm above the floor. (See Note A-3.8.3.6.(4).)

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.81. to 3.2.2.90., a building classified as Group F, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.80.(2).
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.24.to 3.2.2.28., a building classified as Group A, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.23.(2).

Variation Sentence: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Appendix D is permitted to be penetrated by openings leading into ducts within the ceiling space, provided the ducts are sheet steel, and the number of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of Appendix.
Full Code Sentence: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Table 9.10.3.1.-B or is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of .

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.24. to 3.2.2.28., a building classified as Group A, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.23.(2).
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.75.to 3.2.2.79., a building classified as Group F, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.74.(2).

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.24. to 3.2.2.28., a building classified as Group A, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.23.(2).
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(3)and 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.81.to 3.2.2.90., a building classified as Group F, Division 3 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.80.(2).

Variation Sentence: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. shall not contain except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy, or a Group A, Division 2 or Group E major occupancy above the second storey.
Full Code Sentence: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancy, or except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 2, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy above the second storey. (See Note A-3.1.3.2. to .)

Variation Sentence: Roof-top enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.
Full Code Sentence: A roof-top enclosure provided for elevator machinery, a stairway or a service room used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.
Full Code Sentence: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.

Variation Sentence: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.
Full Code Sentence: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.4.1. and 3.2.4.1.(3), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which an automatic sprinkler system is installed.
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted in Sentences 9.10.18.2.(3)and 9.10.18.2.(4), a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which a sprinkler system is installed.

Variation Sentence: This Subsection applies to pedestrian ramps, except ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.
Full Code Sentence: This Subsection applies to landings, except landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.

Variation Sentence: This Subsection applies to landings, except landings for ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.
Full Code Sentence: This Subsection applies to pedestrian ramps, except ramps in a barrier-free path of travel.

Variation Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 2.14., 3.4., 4.12., 5.7., 6.9. and 7.4.(See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Section 2.8. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
Full Code Sentence: Words in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

Variation Sentence: Words that appear in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..
Full Code Sentence: Words in italics are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

Variation Sentence: Where the principal ventilation fan is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.3.(5), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control.
Full Code Sentence: Where a supplemental exhaust fan required by this Article is controlled by a dehumidistat or other automatic control in addition to the manual switch required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(6), the manual switch shall be capable of activating the fan regardless of the setting of the automatic control. (See Note A-9.32.3.8.)

Variation Sentence: The requirements in Sentences 9.9.4.2. and 9.9.4.2. do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided the passageway has not less than 50% of its exterior sides open to the outdoors and is served by an exit stair at each end of the passageway.
Full Code Sentence: The requirements of Sentences 3.4.4.1.(1)and 3.2.3.13.(1)and 3.2.3.13. do not apply to an exterior exit passageway provided not less than 50% of the exterior side is open to the outdoors, and an exit stair is provided at each end of the passageway.

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of determining the actual percentage of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face is permitted to be taken at a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: Where materials used for the preparation of the substrate for roofing are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-A, they shall conform to that standard.
Full Code Sentence: Where roofing materials are covered in the scope of a standard listed in Table 9.26.2.1.-B, they shall conform to that standard.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.82. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area that is not limited if the building is not more than 1 storey in building height, not more than 21 600 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, not more than 14 400 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, not more than 10 800 m2 if 4 storeys in building height, not more than 8 640 m2 if 5 storeys in building height, or not more than 7 200 m2 if 6 storeys in building height.
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Articles 3.2.2.71.to 3.2.2.73., a building classified as Group F, Division 1 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.70. provided it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 9 000 m2 if 1 storey in building height, 4 500 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, 3 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height, or 2 250 m2 if 4 storeys in building height.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.81. provided it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.81.
Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group C is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.52. provided it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.52.

Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.56. provided it is not more than 6 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than the value in Table 3.2.2.56.

Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentence 3.2.2.7. and Articles 3.2.2.75.to 3.2.2.79., a building classified as Group F, Division 2 shall conform to Sentence 3.2.2.74.(2).

Full Code Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Section 2.8. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.15.5.(4), where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 0.6 m and less than 1.2 m, the exposing building face and any exterior wall located above the exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, and the cladding shall be metal or noncombustible cladding installed in accordance with Section 9.20., Subsection 9.27.11. or Section 9.28. (see Note A-9.10.14.5.(1)), the cladding shall conform to Subsection 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8., 9.27.9, , or 9.27.10., be installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), the cladding shall conform to Subsection 9.27.12., be installed with or without furring members over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements, or the wall assembly shall comply with Clause 3.1.5.5.(1) when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Article 3.1.4.8., the requirement in Table 3.2.3.7. for noncombustible cladding for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face is permitted to be waived where the limiting distance is greater than 5 m, the building or fire compartment and all combustible attic and roof spaces are sprinklered throughout, the cladding conforms to Subsections 9.27.6., 9.27.7., 9.27.8., 9.27.9.or 9.27.10., is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with ASTM D 2898-10 Accelerated Weathering of Fire-Retardant-Treated Wood for Fire Testing has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 on the exterior face when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(1), the cladding conforms to Subsection 9.27.12., is installed with or without furring members over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with Sentence 3.1.12.1.(2), and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements, or the exterior wall assembly complies with Article 3.1.5.5.

Variation Sentence: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with balancing dampers that can be fixed in their adjusted positions, and include devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.
Full Code Sentence: All branch supply ducts that are not fitted with diffusers with adjustable balance stops shall be supplied with adjustable dampers and fitted with devices to indicate the positions of the dampers.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5. to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5. shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Full Code Sentence: The limits on the area of glazed openings shall not apply to the exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

Variation Sentence: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5.
Full Code Sentence: Ramps in a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to the requirements in Article 3.8.3.5. (See also Article 9.9.3.2.)

Variation Sentence: Stairs within dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(3), flights with rectangular treads and winders, or flights with a mix of rectangular and tapered treads.
Full Code Sentence: Stairs in buildings other than dwelling units and houses with a secondary suite, including their common spaces, shall consist of straight flights, except as provided in Sentence 9.8.3.1.(4), curved flights, or except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.7.(2), spiral stairs.

Variation Sentence: Manufactured and pre-assembled windows, doors and skylights and their installation shall conform to CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard), CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights the remainder of this Subsection, and the applicable requirements in part 9.
Full Code Sentence: Windows, doors and skylights and their components shall comply with the minimum air leakage requirements stated in CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights (Harmonized Standard), and CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights

Variation Sentence: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.
Full Code Sentence: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide.

Variation Sentence: Provision shall be made for the free flow of air to or from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing grilles in doors.
Full Code Sentence: Provision shall be made for the return of air from all rooms by leaving gaps beneath doors, using louvred doors or installing return duct inlets. (See Note A-9.33.6.13.)

Variation Sentence: The following systems need not comply with Sentence 5.9.3.5.(2): interior windows and interior doors, vehicular access doors (garage doors), storm windows and storm doors, commercial entrance systems, revolving doors, smoke and relief air vents, site-built door systems, and commercial steel doors.
Full Code Sentence: The following systems need not comply with Sentence 5.9.3.4.(2): interior windows and interior doors that do not serve as environmental separators, vehicular access doors (garage doors), storm windows and storm doors, commercial entrance systems, revolving doors, smoke and relief air vents, site-built door systems, and commercial steel doors. (See Note A-5.9.3.4.(3).)

Variation Sentence: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.
Full Code Sentence: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.

Variation Sentence: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.

Variation Sentence: Bathtubs required by Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall be located in a room with a clear floor space not less than 1 500 mm in diameter, be not less than 1 500 mm long, have a clear floor space not less than 750 mm wide adjacent to its entire length, be capable of being accessed along its full length with no tracks mounted on its rim, have faucets and other controls that conform to Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b), and are located on the centre line or between the centre line of the bathtub and the exterior edge of the bathtub rim, at a maximum height of 450 mm above the rim, have three grab bars that conform to Sentence 3.7.2.8.(1), that are not less than 1 200 mm long, two of which are located vertically at each end of the bathtub, set 80 mm to 120 mm in from the outside edge of the bathtub, with their lower end 180 mm to 280 mm above the bathtub rim, and one of which is located horizontally along the length of the bathtub at 180 mm to 280 mm above the bathtub rim, have a slip-resistant bottom surface, and be equipped with a hand-held shower head with not less than 1 800 mm of flexible hose that can be used in a fixed position at a height of 1 200 mm and 2 030 mm.
Full Code Sentence: Where a bathtub is installed in a hotel or a motel, it shall have a clear floor space at least 750 mm wide along its length, except that a water closet or a lavatory is permitted to encroach this space, have faucets and other controls that conform to Clause 3.8.3.8.(1)(b), have a slip-resistant bottom surface, have grab bars that conform to Sentence 3.7.2.8.(1), are not less than 1 200 mm long located vertically at the end of the bathtub that is adjacent to the clear floor space, with the lower end between 180 mm and 280 mm above the bathtub rim, and are not less than 1 200 mm long located horizontally along the length of the bathtub at 180 mm to 280 mm above the bathtub rim, and be capable of being accessed along its full length with no tracks mounted on the bathtub rim.

Variation Sentence: The climatic and seismic values required for the design of buildings under this Code shall be in conformance with the values established by the authority having jurisdiction or, in the absence of such data, with Sentence 1.1.3.1. and the climatic and seismic values in Appendix C. (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: The climatic values required for the design of buildings under this Code shall be in conformance with the values established by the authority having jurisdiction or, in the absence of such data, with the climatic values in Table A- for the location nearest to the building site. (See Note A-1.1.4.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.2., 8.3. and 9.37.(See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Section 2.8. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of determining the actual percentage of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face is permitted to be taken at a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to part 9.
Full Code Sentence: Drainage for crawl spaces shall conform to Section 9.18.

Variation Sentence: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to part 9.
Full Code Sentence: Drainage requirements beneath floors-on-ground shall conform to Section 9.16.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5. to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5. shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Full Code Sentence: The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in Sentence 9.10.14.4. need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

Variation Sentence: The clear height over ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., the clear height over stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall not be less than 1 950 mm.

Variation Sentence: Compliance with the performance requirements described in Sentences 9.7.3.1. to 9.7.3.1. shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in part 9. or 9., and part 9., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.
Full Code Sentence: Compliance with the heat transfer performance requirements described in Sentence 9.7.3.2. shall be demonstrated by complying with the requirements in Article 9.7.3.3., or design and construction conforming to Part 5.

Variation Sentence: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.

Full Code Sentence: Buildings in which a sprinkler system is installed in accordance with NFPA 13D-2016 Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes need not comply with Sentence 3.2.4.1.(1).

Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted in Article 9.10.2.4., in any building containing more than one major occupancy in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another, the requirements of Article 9.10.8.1. for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall be applied to that portion as if the entire building was of that major occupancy.

Full Code Sentence: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3. shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2), and the outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.

Variation Sentence: Except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), a building classified as Group A, Division 2, that is not limited by building area, is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.24.(2), provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, and it is not more than 6 storeys in building height.
Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group D is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.59. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 3 600 m2.

Full Code Sentence: A building classified as Group E is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.65. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7.(1)and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 4 storeys in building height, and it has a building area not more than 1 800 m2.

Full Code Sentence: Not more than 50 L of flammable liquids and combustible liquids, of which not more than 30 L shall be Class I liquids, are permitted to be stored in a garage or shed attached to a dwelling unit.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.2.2. and 9.8.2.2. and Article 9.8.4.7. , the clear height over stairs shall not be less than 2 050 mm.

Full Code Sentence: The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.

Variation Sentence: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.50. or 3.2.2.58. is considered to face 1 street where not less than 25% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of a street or streets.
Full Code Sentence: A building is considered to face 2 streets provided not less than 50% of the building perimeter is located within 15 m of the street or streets.

Variation Sentence: Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building.
Full Code Sentence: Where an exit is located in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, the exit shall be protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls separating the exit from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the exit from the remainder of the building. (See Sentence 9.10.9.3. for closures.)

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in 3.10., 4.5., 5.10., 6.4., 7.2., 8.3. and 9.37.(See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1)(b), the objective and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objective and functional statements identified in Sections 3.5., 4.5., 5.5., 6.5., 7.5.and 8.5. (See Note A-1.1.3.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in Division B shall be the objectives and functional statements identified in Sections 2.14., 3.4., 4.12., 5.7., 6.9. and 7.4.(See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purposes of compliance with this Code as required in Clause 1.2.1.1.(1) of Division A, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 2.8.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.7.3. and 9.9.8.2.(2), from the point where a doorway described in Sentence 9.9.7.2. or 9.9.7.2. enters the public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
Full Code Sentence: Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.3. opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.

Variation Sentence: A building conforming to Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain a Group A, Division 1 or 3, Group B, or Group F, Division 1 major occupancy, or except as provided in Sentence 3.1.3.2.(5), a Group A, Division 2, Group E, or Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy above the second storey.
Full Code Sentence: A building that is wholly constructed in accordance with the building area and construction requirements of Article 3.2.2.58. shall not contain Group A, Division 2, Group E, and Group F, Division 2 or 3 major occupancies above the second storey, or a storage garage above the third storey (see also Sentence 4.4.2.1.(1)).

Variation Sentence: Openings in fire separations shall be protected with closures in conformance with the NBC.
Full Code Sentence: Where closures in fire separations are replaced, the replacements shall be in conformance with the NBC.

Variation Sentence: Where closures in fire separations are replaced, the replacements shall be in conformance with the NBC.
Full Code Sentence: Openings in fire separations shall be protected with closures in conformance with the NBC.

Variation Sentence: Ramps serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 860 mm wide.
Full Code Sentence: Exit stairs serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall have a width of not less than 860 mm.

Variation Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.15.5. to 9.10.15.5.(11), Sentence 9.10.15.5. shall not apply to buildings containing 1 or 2 dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Full Code Sentence: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.14.4.-A to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: For the purpose of using Table 9.10.15.4. to determine the maximum permitted area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Article 9.10.15.5. and Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)
Full Code Sentence: For the purpose of determining the actual percentage of unprotected openings permitted in an exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face is permitted to be taken at a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).) (See Note A-3.2.3.1.(4).)

Variation Sentence: Every plumbing system shall be designed and installed in conformance with appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the NPC.
Full Code Sentence: Portable extinguishers shall be installed in all buildings, except within dwelling units, in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, the NFC.

Variation Sentence: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2. shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4. , A-9.25.3.4., and A-9.25.3.6.(2).)
Full Code Sentence: The perimeter of the ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.2. shall be sealed to the foundation wall. (See Notes A-9.13.4., A-9.25.3.4. and 9.25.3.6., and A-9.25.3.6. and .)

Variation Sentence: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations. (See Note A-5.1.2.1.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.

Variation Sentence: Except as required in Article 9.10.9.14. and as permitted by Sentence 9.10.9.13.(2), each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.
Full Code Sentence: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.9.14.(2), 9.10.9.14.(3)and 9.10.9.14. and Article 9.10.21.2., suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

Variation Sentence: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1. (See Note A-5.9.3.2.(1).)
Full Code Sentence: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Section 5.6.

Full Code Sentence: Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Section 5.4.

Variation Sentence: Unprotected openings in exterior walls of the building shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5. and 9.10.13.7., where an unenclosed exterior exit stair or ramp provides the only means of egress from a suite and is exposed to fire from unprotected openings in the exterior walls of another fire compartment, or another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and unprotected openings in the exterior walls of the building are within 3 m horizontally and less than 10 m below or less than 5 m above the exit stair or ramp.
Full Code Sentence: Unprotected openings shall be protected with wired glass in fixed steel frames or glass block conforming to Articles 9.10.13.5.and 9.10.13.7., where an exterior exit door in one fire compartment is within 3 m horizontally of an unprotected opening serving another fire compartment, or in one dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite is within 3 m horizontally of the unprotected openings serving another dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space in a house with a secondary suite, and the exterior walls of the fire compartments, dwelling units, ancillary spaces and common spaces in a house with a secondary suite referred to in Clause 9.9.4.6.(1) intersect at an exterior angle of less than 135°.
